Description: Pottery dinos with friezes of grazing wild goats.
Producer name: Attributed to: The London Dinos Group
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Etruria (historic - Italy) ('Purchased from Signor Bassegio', along with nine other pots of clearly Etruscan provenance)
Curator's comments: Even though the register notes no findspot, and K.F. Kinch, Vroulia, p. 192, confirms the lack of findspot information, Elinor Price in JHS 44, p. 195, cites Camirus as the findspot, with no further comment. The stand (1848.6-19.1.b) originally associated with the dinos (see the illustration in Kinch, Vroulia) does not belong and was recognised as Corinthian by H. Payne, Necrocorinthia, p. 276. See also Boardman, Antike Kunst 13 (1970) 93. For an extensive discussion of the London Dinos group and its name vase, see M. Kerschner, "On the Provenance of Aiolian Pottery", in Naukratis: Greek Diversity in Egypt, ed. A. Villing & U. Schlotzhauer (London, 2006), 109-126.
Bibliographic references: Old Catalogue / A Catalogue of the Greek and Etruscan Vases in the British Museum (420)
Kerschner 2006 / On the Provenance of Aiolian Pottery (p.122 fig.2, Appendix 2 Kam1)
